content.description: Approach and climb both aliens from the high saddle between them. This is the shorter and easier alien with an ice axe looking like rock on the summit. Climb some fun crack climbing to a bolt. Clip the bolt and do a committing boulder problem on good solid holds to the anchor. Anchor is super bomber as of 2018. Super good!
content.protection: Singles with maybe doubles in hand sized. Don't need much. No iron needed.
content.location: Start on the high saddle. Look for bolt. Follow crack to it. If you can't find this route then you probably can't find the approach to it.

content.description:
Start on the same saddle as for both aliens. Free climb the first half at 5.10ish with good gear in some Â occasional detached flakes. Soon enough the free climbing ended for me and I was doing some thin nailing between cam placements. Then the cam placements end all together. Hammer in some peckers then do some mud juju through shit rock to a fixed KB. Soon enough an anchor presents itself. Anchor is in great shape as of 2018. I added some tat to it.

The guidebook calls this A4 but I don't think it's in that range. Perhaps A2 or A2+ is more fitting for the mystery's.
content.protection: Pins, peckers, spectres, hooks, thin stuff. Doubles in cams.
content.location: Same approach as for the aliens. This summit is one of the coolest hoodoo summits in the area!

pathTokens: Mystery Towers & Top of the World Overlook
